name: Hpatoio Bitly Client
description: Guzzle service description of Bitly API

Highvalue.summary: Returns a specified number of "high-value" bitly links that are popular across bitly at this particular moment.

limit.description: The maximum number of high-value links to return.

Search.summary: Search links receiving clicks across bitly by content, language, location, and more.

limit.description: The maximum number of links to return.

offset.description: Which result to start with (defaults to 0)

lang.description: Favor results in this language (two letter ISO code).

cities.description: Show links active in this city (ordered like country-state-city, e.g. us-il-chicago).

domain.description: Restrict results to this web domain (like bitly.com).

full_domain.description: Restrict results to this full web domain (like blog.bitly.com)

fields.description: which fields to return in the response (comma-separated). May be any of: domain, initial_epoch, h2, h3, site, lastindexed, keywords, last_indexed_epoch, title, initial, summaryText, content, score, summaryTitle, type, description, cities, lang, url, referrer, aggregate_link, lastseen, page, ogtitle, aggregate_link. By default, all will be returned

RealtimeBursting_phrases.summary: Returns phrases that are receiving an uncharacteristically high volume of click traffic, and the individual links (hashes) driving traffic to pages containing these phrases

RealtimeHot_phrases.summary: Returns phrases that are receiving a consistently high volume of click traffic, and the individual links (hashes) driving traffic to pages containing these phrases

RealtimeClickrate.summary: Returns the click rate for content containing a specified phrase

phrase.description: The phrase for which you'd like to get the click rate

LinkInfo.summary: Returns metadata about a single bitly link

LinkContent.summary: Returns the “main article” from the linked page, as determined by the content extractor, in either HTML or plain text format

content_type.description: specifies whether to return the content as html or plain text (default: html).

LinkCategory.summary: Returns the detected categories for a document, in descending order of confidence

LinkSocial.summary: Returns the "social score" for a specified bitly link. Note that the social score are highly dependent upon activity (clicks) occurring on the bitly link. If there have not been clicks on a bitly link within the last 24 hours, it is possible a social score for that link does not exist.

Returns the "social score" for a specified bitly link. Note that the social score are highly dependent upon activity (clicks) occurring on the bitly link. If there have not been clicks on a bitly link within the last 24 hours, it is possible a social score for that link does not exist.

LinkLocation.summary: Returns the significant locations for the bitly link or None if locations do not exist. Note that locations are highly dependent upon activity (clicks) occurring on the bitly link. If there have not been clicks on a bitly link within the last 24 hours, it is possible that location data for that link does not exist.

Expand.summary: Given a bitly URL or hash (or multiple), returns the target (long) URL.

shortUrl.description: Refers to one or more bitly links. e.g.: http://bit.ly/1RmnUT or http://j.mp/1RmnUT.

hash.description: Refers to one or more bitly hashes. e.g.: 2bYgqR or a-custom-name.

Info.summary: This is used to return the page title for a given bitly link.

hash.description: Refers to one or more bitly hashes. e.g.: 2bYgqR or a-custom-name.

shortUrl.description: Refers to one or more bitly links e.g.: http://bit.ly/1RmnUT or http://j.mp/1RmnUT.

expand_user.description: Optional true|false - include extra user info in response.

LinkLookup.summary: This is used to query for a bitly link based on a long URL.

url.description: One or more long URLs to lookup.

LinkLookup.summary: This is used to query for a bitly link based on a long URL.

url.description: One or more long URLs to lookup.

Shorten.summary: Given a long URL, returns a bitly short URL.

longUrl.description: A long URL to be shortened (example: http://iliveinperego.com/).

domain.description: refers to a preferred domain; either bit.ly, j.mp, or bitly.com, for users who do NOT have a custom short domain set up with bitly.

UserLink_edit.summary: Changes link metadata in a user's history.

link.description: The bitly link to be edited

title.description: Optional - The title of this bitmark.

note.description: Optional - A description of, or note about, this bitmark.

private.description: Optional - Boolean true or false indicating privacy setting (defaults to user-level setting).

user_ts.description: Optional - Timestamp as an integer epoch.

archived.description: Optional - Boolean true or false indicating whether or not link is to be archived.

edit.description: A comma separated string of fields to be edited. ie: to edit the note field you also need to pass edit=note.

UserLink_lookup.summary: This is used to query for a bitly link shortened by the authenticated user based on a long URL.

longUrl.description: One or more long URLs to lookup.

UserLink_save.summary: Saves a link as a bitmark in a user's history, with optional pre-set metadata. (Also returns a short URL for that link.)

longUrl.description: The URL to be saved as a bitmark.

title.description: Optional - The title of this bitmark.

note.description: Optional - A description of, or note about, this bitmark.

private.description: Optional - Boolean true or false indicating privacy setting (defaults to user-level setting).

user_ts.description: Optional - Timestamp as an integer epoch.

UserSave_custom_domain_keyword.summary: Save a custom keyword for a custom short domain. This endpoint is only available to paid customers.

keyword_link.description: The short domain and keyword combination

target_link.description: The bitly short URL the specified keyword will map to
